LAW OFFICE OF
DIANNE JAMES DAVIS
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Telephone: 256-392-3172 Facsimile: 256-392-3578
April 2, 2025
Via Email Only
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8 th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
Re: Brittany Michelle Gilliland vs. Christopher Blaine McGregor
In the Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alexander City Division
Case #70-DR-2023-900051.01
Dear Barbie:
As you know, we have court on Thursday. It is my understanding that Brittany and
Blaine would like to discuss a possible resolution. According to Blaine, the co-parenting has
been going great. Brittany recently attended one of Addie Kate’s soccer games and sat with
Blaine and his family, and Addie Kate stated that “it was nice to see everyone getting along”.
Additionally, Blaine and Brittany have worked together to schedule family dinners &
activities so that Brittany and Addie Kate could spend time together while also ensuring Addie
Kate felt comfortable. Blaine, Brittany, Addie Kate, & Bennett spent time together-shopping,
playing at the park, and lunch after Addie Kate’s soccer game. Blaine also allowed Brittany an
extra Friday night and all-day Saturday with Bennett so they could attend Monster Jam. On one
occasion, when Brittany was in Alexander City, she met Blaine and the kids at the park and had
dinner afterwards. Overall, things have been much calmer, and Blaine says that Addie Kate is
starting to become more open minded when it comes to her mother. He truly wants a positive
co-parenting relationship with Brittany.
Blaine believes that forcing visitation on Addie Kate has not worked, this more natural
and normal approach will continue to lead them in the right direction to improve the
mother-daughter relationship between Brittany and Addie Kate.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
70-DR-2023-900051.01
Page 1 of 2
Blaine proposes the following:
Rather than Bennett and possibly, in the future, Addie Kate, visiting with their mother the
1 st and 3 r d weekends from Thursday to Monday, given Brittany’s move and the long round trip,
Blaine suggests every other weekend from Friday to Sunday. He will gladly pick Bennett up and
have him ready when Brittany arrives to pick him up. This does not preclude her from picking
him up from school if she is able.
Regarding Addie Kate, Blaine believes she should be allowed to decide when she’s
comfortable enough to visit with her mother, as forcing the issue has not been beneficial at all.
Please discuss with your client as Blaine believes that going to court will cause the
relationship to go back to square one. His words to me were “if we can’t co-parent and stay out
of the courtroom, none of this will ever get better.”
Sincerely,
Dianne James Davis
DJD/ts
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
70-DR-2023-900051.01
Page 2 of 2
